worklogs.comment:
davisusanibar opened a new pull request, #13227:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13227

   For Java side currently we are offering nightly builds Jar artifacts uploaded to GitHub repository as an assets.
   
   Then, if a user decided to use that in their local projects they need to download that Jar assets from the GitHub nightly packages and i[nstall that manually one by one as Jar needed as mention in the documentation](https://arrow.apache.org/docs/java/install.html#installing-nightly-packages).
   
   Trying to figure out if there are some option to use GitHub nightly builds Jar artifacts as a really repository and only configure the nightly build in my pom.xml for example and maven be able to download dependencies needed automatically.

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #13227:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13227#issuecomment-1136348628

   https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-16553

github-actions[bot] commented on PR #13227:

   Revision: 1c9392265e60f4519f3e6e6564b598aed97d9d3e
   
   Submitted crossbow builds: [ursacomputing/crossbow @ actions-7a102b9b5e](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/branches/all?query=actions-7a102b9b5e)
   
   |Task|Status|
   |----|------|
   |java-jars|[![Github Actions](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/workflows/Crossbow/badge.svg?branch=actions-7a102b9b5e-github-java-jars)](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/actions?query=branch:actions-7a102b9b5e-github-java-jars)|

amol- commented on PR #13227:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13227#issuecomment-1137008475

   Should we update https://arrow.apache.org/docs/java/install.html#installing-nightly-packages too ?

davisusanibar commented on PR #13227:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13227#issuecomment-1137109076

   > Should we update https://arrow.apache.org/docs/java/install.html#installing-nightly-packages too ?
   
   There is more changes on the way. Using [Github release](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/releases/tag/nightly-2022-03-19-0-github-java-jars) is not possible to use/configure as a maven/gradle repository there is no option to create folder inside a [release](https://docs.github.com/es/repositories/releasing-projects-on-github/managing-releases-in-a-repository)
   
   Working on a change to after GitHub release complete successfully, then add a new commit to [crossbow](https://github.com/davisusanibar/crossbow) on the same branch used for release that are containing folder structure and jar needed.

davisusanibar commented on PR #13227:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13227#issuecomment-1137112256

   > > Should we update https://arrow.apache.org/docs/java/install.html#installing-nightly-packages too ?
   > 
   > There is more changes on the way. Using [Github release](https://github.com/ursacomputing/crossbow/releases/tag/nightly-2022-03-19-0-github-java-jars) is not possible to use/configure as a maven/gradle repository there is no option to create folder inside a [release](https://docs.github.com/es/repositories/releasing-projects-on-github/managing-releases-in-a-repository)
   > 
   > Working on a change to after GitHub release complete successfully, then add a new commit to [crossbow](https://github.com/davisusanibar/crossbow) on the same branch used for release that are containing folder structure and jar needed.
   
   If a directory is sending on the release payload this is replaced `/` by `.` as you could see at https://github.com/davisusanibar/crossbow/releases/tag/v1.0.0

davisusanibar closed pull request #13227: ARROW-16553: [Java] Initial changes to configure GitHub nightly builds Jar as a repository to use from Maven/Gradle
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13227

davisusanibar commented on PR #13227:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13227#issuecomment-1138672980

   Just close this PR. This is a more configurable manner to implement this at https://github.com/apache/arrow/blob/master/.github/workflows/r_nightly.yml

assignUser commented on code in PR #13328:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/13328#discussion_r891261268


##########
.github/workflows/java_nightly.yml:
##########
@@ -0,0 +1,188 @@
+# Licensed to the Apache Software Foundation (ASF) under one
+# or more contributor license agreements.  See the NOTICE file
+# distributed with this work for additional information
+# regarding copyright ownership.  The ASF licenses this file
+# to you under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the
+# "License"); you may not use this file except in compliance
+# with the License.  You may obtain a copy of the License at
+#
+#   http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0
+#
+# Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing,
+# software distributed under the License is distributed on an
+# "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY
+# KIND, either express or implied.  See the License for the
+# specific language governing permissions and limitations
+# under the License.
+
+name: Upload Java Nightly builds
+
+on:
+  workflow_dispatch:
+    inputs:
+      prefix:
+        description: Job prefix to use.
+        required: false
+        default: ''
+      dependency_to_install:
+        description: In case need to upload custom artifact to nightly repository (i.e memory / flight / others).
+        required: false
+        default: 'arrow'
+  schedule:
+    - cron: '0 14 * * *'
+jobs:
+  upload:
+    env:
+      PREFIX: ${{ github.event.inputs.prefix || ''}}
+      DEPENDENCY_TO_INSTALL: ${{ github.event.inputs.dependency_to_install || ''}}
+    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
+    steps:
+      - name: Checkout Arrow
+        uses: actions/checkout@v3
+        with:
+          fetch-depth: 1
+          path: arrow
+          repository: apache/arrow
+          ref: master
+          submodules: recursive
+      - name: Checkout Crossbow
+        uses: actions/checkout@v3
+        with:
+          fetch-depth: 0
+          path: crossbow
+          repository: ursacomputing/crossbow
+          ref: master
+      - name: Set up Python
+        uses: actions/setup-python@v3
+        with:
+          cache: 'pip'
+          python-version: 3.8
+      - name: Install Archery
+        shell: bash
+        run: pip install -e arrow/dev/archery[all]
+#      - name: Download Artifacts
+#        run: |
+#          if [ -z $PREFIX ]; then
+#            PREFIX=nightly-packaging-$(date +%Y-%m-%d)-0
+#          fi
+#          echo $PREFIX
+#          # problem about rate limit using github3 without API_TOKEN
+#          archery crossbow download-artifacts -f java-jars -t arrow_java_$(date +"%d-%m-%Y") $PREFIX
+#          if [ -n "$(ls -A arrow_java_$(date +"%d-%m-%Y")/*)" ]; then
+#            echo "Found files!"
+#            echo "GOT_FILES=true" >> $GITHUB_ENV
+#          else
+#            echo "No files found. Stopping upload."
+#            echo "GOT_FILES=false" >> $GITHUB_ENV
+#          fi
+#         tree arrow_java_$(date +"%d-%m-%Y")
+      - shell: bash
+        name: Download Artifacts
+        run: |
+          if [ -z $PREFIX ]; then
+            PREFIX=nightly-packaging-$(date +%Y-%m-%d)-0
+          fi
+          if [ -z $DEPENDENCY_TO_INSTALL ]; then
+            DEPENDENCY_TO_INSTALL=arrow
+          fi
+          ARROW_JAVA_NIGHTLY_VERSION=$PREFIX'-github-java-jars'
+          TMP_FOLDER=arrow_java_$(date +%Y-%m-%d)
+          mkdir -p $TMP_FOLDER
+          pushd $TMP_FOLDER
+          # this download artifacts should be executed thru crossbow (workaround to solve problem about rate limit using github3 without API_TOKEN)
+          echo "**************** 1 - Download $ARROW_JAVA_NIGHTLY_VERSION dependencies ****************"
+          wget $( \
+            wget \
+              "-qO-" "https://api.github.com/repos/ursacomputing/crossbow/releases/tags/$ARROW_JAVA_NIGHTLY_VERSION" \
+              | jq -r '.assets[] | select((.name | endswith(".pom")) or (.name | endswith(".jar"))) | .browser_download_url' \
+              | grep $DEPENDENCY_TO_INSTALL )

Review Comment:
   Why are you not using `archery crossbow download-artifacts` for this?

+          fi
+          ARROW_JAVA_NIGHTLY_VERSION=$PREFIX'-github-java-jars'
+          TMP_FOLDER=arrow_java_$(date +%Y-%m-%d)

+              | grep $DEPENDENCY_TO_INSTALL )

Review Comment:
   This download artifacts should be executed thru crossbow (this is a workaround to solve problem about rate limit using github3 without API_TOKEN):
   
   `github3.exceptions.ForbiddenError: 403 API rate limit exceeded for IP***.154. (But here's the good news: Authenticated requests get a higher rate limit. Check out the documentation for more details.)`
   
   Error message: https://github.com/davisusanibar/testing-github-ci/runs/6775682914?check_suite_focus=true

               fi

   ```suggestion
           if: ${{ github.repository == 'apache/arrow' }}
   ```
   This prevents it from failing in forks etc.

-#            echo "GOT_FILES=true" >> $GITHUB_ENV
-#          else
-#            echo "No files found. Stopping upload."
-#            echo "GOT_FILES=false" >> $GITHUB_ENV

-      - shell: bash

           if [ -z $PREFIX ]; then

-          fi
-          if [ -z $DEPENDENCY_TO_INSTALL ]; then
-            DEPENDENCY_TO_INSTALL=arrow
+            PREFIX=$(date +%Y-%m-%d)

Review Comment:
   With this and line 69 you will only ever be able to upload nightly builds of the jars, not jars created in a PR via crossbow. For the R nightlies we need the ability to use fully custom prefixes for release etc.. If that is not a use case for java ok but might be better to keep the option open?

Review Comment:
   I can not comment on line 152 :
   echo "Please! Review $FILE, it was not intalled on m2 locally."  <- typo *installed*
   
   Should this not kill the workflow? Because this would mean not all files would be uploaded which could lead to a mix of versions and issues installing (maybe java can handle that but I think it would be cleaner to either upload all files or none)

Review Comment:
   it looks like `mvn install` downloads a bunch of dependencies, it would be nice if we could cache those.
   A cursory googling shows that adding the caching action with these inputs prior to this step should work:
   ```
   - name: Cache Maven Dependencies
           uses: actions/cache@v3
           with:
             path: |
               ~/.m2/repository/**
               !~/.m2/repository/org/apache/arrow
             key: java-nightly-dependencies
   ```

Review Comment:
   I have changed this behaviour and removed the envvar in the R workflow in favour of explicitly failing the job with `exit 1` if there are no files downloaded. You can then also remove the `if: `s that reference it

fields.description:
For Java side currently we are offering nightly builds Jar artifacts uploaded to GitHub repository as an assets.

Then, if a user decided to use that in their local projects they need to download that Jar assets from the GitHub nightly packages and i[nstall that manually one by one as Jar needed as mention in the documentation|https://arrow.apache.org/docs/java/install.html#installing-nightly-packages].

Trying to figure out if there are some option to use GitHub nightly builds Jar artifacts as a really repository and only configure the nightly build in my pom.xml for example and maven be able to download dependencies needed automatically.
fields.summary: [Java][CI] Use GitHub repository Jar assets as a repository that could be consumed by dependencies management (Maven/Gradle)
